title: Change in GPE of Block-Earth System

content.question: A <math alttext="4 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> block is pushed up an incline that makes a <math alttext="30 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> angle with the horizontal, as shown in the figure. Once the block is pushed a distance of <math alttext="d equals 5.0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> up the incline, the block remains at rest. What is the approximate change in the gravitational potential energy of the block-Earth system when the block is held at rest compared to its original location at the bottom of the incline?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 Joule" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="100 times the square root of 3, end square root, Joules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
